themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The text begins with the formal resolution of the association, indicating it is a decree passed by the group.

themes.label: Honorific Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The inscription praises the priest Kraton for his goodwill, philanthropy, and dedication to the association.
themes.quote: πολλὰς καὶ μεγάλας ἀποδείξεις ἐποιεῖτο τῆς πρὸς τοὺς Ἀτταλιστὰς εὐνοίας

themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The text explicitly mentions a sacred law left by Kraton regarding the regulations of the association and its rituals.
themes.quote: κυρῶσαι μὲν τὸν ἱερὸν νόμον τὸν πολελειμμένον ὑπὸ Κράτωνος

themes.label: Accounts and Financial Records
themes.rationale: The inscription records a specific endowment of 10,500 Alexandrian drachmas and discusses the use of the resulting income.
themes.quote: ἀργυρίου Ἀλεξανδρείου δραχμὰς μυρίας καὶ πεντακοσίας ὧν ἐκ τῆς προσόδου θυσίας τε καὶ συνόδους [πε]ποιήμεθα

themes.label: Building Commemoration
themes.rationale: The text records the dedication of specific buildings, including the Attaleion and a housing complex, to the association.
themes.quote: τό τε Ἀττάλειον τὸ πρὸς τῶι θεάτρωι... καὶ τὴν συνοικίαν τὴν πρὸς τῶι βασιλείωι

themes.label: Official Letters
themes.rationale: The inscription mentions a letter written by Kraton and sent to the association by King Attalus.
themes.quote: γράψας ἐπιστολὴν πρὸς τοὺς Ἀτταλιστὰς... ἣν ἐξαπέστειλεν ἡμῖν βασιλεὺς Ἄτταλος

persons.name: Kraton
persons.role: Priest of the association and benefactor

persons.name: Alexander
persons.role: Referenced in the context of Alexandrian currency

places.name: Attaleion
places.type: Sanctuary or building dedicated to the association

rationale: The inscription is a detailed decree from the association of the Attalistai in Teos, honoring their deceased priest Kraton. It outlines his significant financial and architectural benefactions, including an endowment of 10,500 drachmas and the dedication of the Attaleion. It also confirms the legal status of a sacred law he left behind to govern the group's activities. The text contains several lacunae and restored sections, indicating its fragmentary state.
